Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DannyMarkLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Feb 2012 and although it is a little walk (5 mins uphill) from San Pietro Station (Not an underground station) it is still a lovely little quaint hotel that offers very good views of the Vatican. The rooms are nice, with good room service and very friendly staff. You can access the free wi-fi and breakfast is good. For the price of the hotel it is great value for money and Rome is amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Darshy
Reviews.Content: We got a taxi from the airport which dropped us at the bottom of a hill and poitned us in the general direction. The hotel WAS hard to find but once you have mastered it its not a bad walk. Wouldnt recommend to anyone too unfit though. (we didnt find the shortcut till the last day) Most of the staff were polite and we liked our room. It had a small amount of damp on the ceiling but you could see they had tried to clean it off. There was a tv in the room but we never turned it on. We went down for breakfast most morning's and you do have to get there at a good time as the week we stayed there were lots of greedy people stuffing themselves but we always found something. The lady who worked in the breakfast hall wasnt the friendliest person but we didnt care much. To get free wi-fi just go down to reception and they will give you a password. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who doesnt mind not being right in the centre of Rome. Mind you, we could see the vatican from our bedroom window and it was only a 10 min walk. Everything is in walking distance, I wouldnt bother with buses at all and we only used the metro when we really had to as everything seemed in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away !!!”
Reviews.Author: lhtfdn
Reviews.Content: it was at the end of august and was the first time that i ve been in Rome while expecting to have a wonderful holiday . Because of this hotel , i couldnt sleep well and absolutaley recommend you to find another one. First it was so hot and the aircondition was not working , second the tv was one of the oldest one that an hotel can have in this decade and also the remote control was broken . Then there was only mineral water ,which i dont like , in the mini bar nothing more ,and the furnitures were terrible. On the other side the bathroom was ok but could be better , and the hotel is nearer to Vatican City . This hotel doesn't deserve 3 stars maybe 2 ...

Reviews.Title: “a value for money hotel close to Vatican City & San Pietro Station”
Reviews.Author: n0madfamily
Reviews.Content: We booked a taxi through the Hotel from the Airport which cost us 50euros. I'm glad we did as this Hotel is based in a residential area which I believe a regular taxi would have trouble finding. Its location is about a 5 minute walk from San Pietro Station and a 10-15 minute walk from Vatican City. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby for your convenience but all located down a hill so be prepared for the walk back up again!. We are a family of 4 so we booked 2 rooms as the bigger rooms were unavailable to us. Bit disappointed they had not put the 2 rooms together but at least they were on the same floor! THe rooms were quite small but both were clean, with a fridge, tv, own bathroom and a comfortable bed. Reception were very helpful in helping us to get around,knowing bus routes as well as train routes and were quite happy to write instructions on a map for us. Breakfast was a basic continental with a little extra of bacon and scrambled eggs. Overall we felt this hotel was great value for money and a great location and would definately choose to stay here again on our return.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was not all that great....”
Reviews.Author: slikdeals
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves 2.5 stars but no more. I'm going to start with the most important thing: location which is the reason why I chose to stay at this hotel. On the map the hotel appears to be very close to the Vatican, but it’s actually on top of a whiny hill walking down the road takes a lot longer then it appears and you could take the stairs but that also long and difficult to traverse if you have luggage. So the location is actually more inconvenient then it appears. A/C was a problem it didn't work!!! The receptionist told me it was only on during the hours of 1pm to 6pm? What a terrible excuse. Other problem we had was the plumbing, since there was no shower in enclosure the water did not drain and so the water leaked out of the bathroom. Reported that and they fixed it the next day, but the A/C they said they would turn it on additional hours of 10pm to 4am? WTH its June and its hot but these people won't fix the A/C!!! I would not come back to this hotel and I would NOT recommend any one to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: farfalla0217
Reviews.Content: Staff not willing to help with your needs. Uncaring and dishonest. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody. Also, location is not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We'll not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ToTravel_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is difficult to find. It's not close to a metro station but to a train station. It is on a kind of hill so you'll have to walk a little. If you get lost, how we did, you'll climbe some stairs with the suitcases in your hands.So better take a taxi. The staff is indifferent to your needs. In the room there was a specific smell and we were all day with the window open. The towels were not changed everyday. The good thing was the free Wi-Fi and the fact that it is close to Vatican. Sure are other best options to stay in Rome at the same price like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, small breakfast, great views.”
Reviews.Author: Andy17
Reviews.Content: After browsing through a long list of hotels in Rome, I decided on staying here, as Alessandrino appeared to have the best price-quality ratio. And so it did. Although located on a pretty steep hill, it's closer to the center than many others in its price range. The Vatican is no more than 15 minutes away by foot. The rooms are...huge. The one we stayed in even had an interesting curved shape, so you didn't feel you were living in a box. The only downside was the poor breakfast. Admittedly, during the summer you can have it on the terrace atop the hotel, from where you can see far into the distance, to the mountains, and closer to the Vatican dome. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice small hotel close to public transport and Vatican city”
Reviews.Author: Dee_225
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for only 2 nights but have nothing bad to say about the hotel. It is a 3 star hotel so you cannot really expect too much of luxury but was very nice and clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was cozy and had everything we needed even though the internet did not work but we didn't spend much time at the hotel anyway. Our bed was more than comfortable though!! Few minutes down the road (there is short cut ) to San Pietro train station and not more than half an hour walk to Vatican city! There are also number of buses which go to central of Rome. Can only recommend and would definitely go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, near bus and train, accommodating staff, friendly (and very Roman) neighborhood. I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: Classicist_60
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Alessandrino Hotel. The front desk is staffed by accommodating and well-informed employees who are ready to help guests with directions, restaurant suggestions, etc. I needed to make contact with a Roman archaeologist, and Georgio made the phone call for me, negotiated the introductions (my Italian is not ready for a quick phone conversation), and later asked about how things had turned out. I loved breakfast at the Alessandrino. The breakfast room is lovely, or you can eat outside al fresco on the patio. The selection of food includes both hot (bacon and eggs) and cold items (cereal, yogurt, fruit, juices), as well as fresh breads and pastries. This is all included in the price of the room. The building is charming, well-maintained and clean, and it is pleasantly tucked away from the noise and crowds of the city. The rooms have wonderful large windows on vertical hinges that can be opened for a delightful breeze, or closed if you prefer the air conditioning. I stayed for ten days in July, and even though the heat in the city during the day was grueling, there was always a pleasant breeze in my room in the evening (I needed the air conditioning only on the last night I was there). On Via Monte del Gallo (the street that leads from the hotel to everywhere else) includes a very adequate small grocery and a friendly coffee bar. From the San Pietro train station, a larger Carrefour supermarket is just a 3 minute walk (this place is visible from the bus stop at the San Pietro station. I was in Rome to do research at the American Academy library, so I wanted a hotel near the Janiculum hill. I look forward to staying at the Alessandrino the next time I am in Rome, whether to study or to play. It was a great comfort to know that after a long hot day in the library or in the forum I could look forward to going back to the quiet comfort of the Alessandrino. It should be said that a taxi or car is the only sensible way to arrive or depart from this hotel (unless you are young and in good shape). The hotel is located at the end of a side street, about a block from a bus stop and three blocks from the San Pietro train station. Without luggage, the walk to and from the train station is easy and pleasant. The 64 bus departs every 5 minutes from the San Pietro train station, and finishes at the Termini train station--so on it you can get just about anywhere in Rome with only one change. Or you can take a train from the San Pietro station (this is a regional train, not a Metro stop), and go to Termini as well as several other destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Czech81
Reviews.Content: Good value in walking distance to public transport, Vatican city, etc. Little bit difficuilt to find it but Rome is confusing citi at all. Room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad experiences”
Reviews.Author: RANCH99
Reviews.Content: the hotel was walking distance to vatican/st. peters square ,hotel situated in residential area rooms needs updating the hotel was no generator on our second day i woke up around 4am freezing cold no heating no light very dark in my room no emergency light used my mobile as my torch i went to reception did inquire what happen the the male staff who was in the reception doesnt speak english only the hotel was the one no electric we are not informed whats going on instead we are going out early for the day it was delayed we cannot have a bath theres no hot water. the breakfast was not good and the lady on the restaurant was rud we already starting eating our breakfast in the table and she did ask us to be move to other table i did ask she just ignored me didnt give any reason. one night when i arrive on my room the door was open i did complain this to the reception why my room was left opened he just ignored me. just reminder dont leave any valuables inside your room as they dont lock it after cleaners tidy your room. bring torch in case it will happen again its unsafe to walk in the dark. when we arrive at the hotel the lady on the reception was very helpful she speaks english and she gave us a map as our guide.

Reviews.Title: “Non-expensive hotel with convenient location and good service”
Reviews.Author: LGNewYork
Reviews.Content: We chose Alessandrino due do its proximity to Vatican and St. Pietro railway station because we wanted to attend the Papal Audience and leave for the Civitavecchia port just after the event. And it turned out to be the right decision. We were satisfied with good service especially at the front desk. Before our leave for Rome, I bombed the front desk with various questions via email and they usually replied with detailed answers within 10 min! They ordered a limo that picked us up at the airport for only 40 euros per car (the express train from the airport to Termini would cost 24 euros). The only problem with our stay was that local residents once enjoyed their life too loud until midnight - it has been already streesed out in other reviews. I also have to mention that if you find a map of the area via Google or http://www.go-rome-hotels.com/hotel-alessandrino.php, it will show a metro (subway) station there additionally to the railway one. It's misleading info - there is no metro station there so if you need to go to the center of Rome, you could board a train on St. Pietro railway station that goes to Termini and get off on the second stop where you will have a free transfer to the metro (it costs 1 euro). To summarize my review, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inflexible but fine”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_N_JesY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alessandrino with two good friends while traveling in Italy. We tried to cancel our second night to accommodate changing plans, and the staff were completely inflexible - despite our attempt to cancel 48 hours prior. The place was fine. Breakfast was nice. The room seemed clean and the location was fine - it was really just the stubborn staff that was slightly frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: sler1952
Reviews.Content: Reasonably quiet, only disturbance is local residents enjoying life but ends early at night. Room size ok, we stayed in 202, view limited but ok. Hotel would be excellent it has potential. Main gripes Air-con was a trickle of cool air for 3mins then switched off for 30 (must be pre-set cycle) asked reception and all they could suggest was turn dial slowly, reported twice but no solution. Window shutters had to be propped open as wall fittings loose. Toilet seat not fixed and wobbled. Wi-fi was promised but you pay e10 for 3 hours and had to go to reception for signal, reported but reception insisted we should get signal in room but obviously not, reported this twice. Breakfast offered good, just wish staff did not bang dishes and throw cutlery about quite a wake up call in the morning! If you go try bus 34 travels from Cavour to half way up hill - saves the legs! Just wish all hotels would provide two bedside lamps and hooks etc in bathroom for one's wetbags etc. Also asked for additional lamp but it never came either. Unfortunately Rome is known for surliness and attitude to foreigners but hospitality staff could benefit from lesson in PR. Fridge in room was welcomed but you have to stock it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel by the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: BecSutb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has had lots of bad press on this website and others but I personally found the hotel to be very pleasant and felt safe. It is a bit tricky to find but once you know where it is there is a short cut to get down on to the main road which the staff will point out to you. It is literally ten minutes away from the vatican so very easy to get there and to main shops. The train station 'Roma San Pietro' is less than 5 minutes away to get train to airport etc. Decor - little old fashioned but considering that its 3 star and the low price paid it was very reasonable and it was clean. Like many italian hotels the shower is not enclosed, it is like a wet room. Fridge in hotel room, wardrobe and safe that was bolted down to the wardrobe so felt quite safe to use. We had a double room with kingsize bed that was v. comfortable. Breakfast is a standard affair, a few croissants, cereal, biscuits, yogurts, fruit juice. They will do you a fresh cappuccino if you ask the staff who were all pleasant. If you want any drinks at any other time water, cola, alcohol their prices are very reasonable. We sat outside on the sun terrace on the last afternoon, very pleasant and had a drink there. Security - felt safe at all times, came back late one evening about 1.30am and the desk was manned all through the night. If eating out and wanting to be near the hotel would recommend the Goose Pizzeria under the railway lines on opposite side of road to hotel, mainly locals eating there not too touristy and great pizza. Overall this is very good value considering we paid £30 per person per night for bed and breakfast in a central rome location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of thieves”
Reviews.Author: meggie01
Reviews.Content: having checked in at the hotel after taking an age to find it - the taxi driver had no idea, we walked down the hill to find a restaurant. On our return around 9.30 pm, we found the reception unattended but there was a man in what looked like a hotel uniform standing by the lift. We got in the lift and he spoke to us in limited English about the air conditioning not working properly. He got out of the lift at the same floor as us and saw us go into our room. He seemed very pleasant. About 5 minutes later he knocked on the door asking to check the air conditioning in the bedroom and bathroom. He rushed around, tapping the radiator and looking at air vents. Said he would leave it until the morning and disappeared. After another 10 minutes, he was back, said he ought to fix the unit that evening and was very apologetic. We let him in again although we were hot and tired by now and was starting to get ready for bed. He asked for my husband's assistance in the bathroom by him standing on a stool to check the ceiling airvent while he looked at the radiator. After which he quickly went away saying it should be alright now. We then noticed that both our expensive watches had been taken! We had let this man into our room because he had a hotel badge on and we thought he was genuine. My husband rushed to reception and the man there, who had just come on duty, was less than helpful and seemed to take his time understanding that we needed him to call the police and it was a good 15 minutes before he phoned them. By which time of course the thief had got well away. The staff were not at all concerned the next morning either, the only thing they offered us was one free nights accommodation. On top of this the breakfast was disgusting, and the staff not helpful. Visitors to this hotel, be warned. Don't let anyone into your room. By the way, the safe barrel came away in our hands when trying to lock it!

Reviews.Title: “beware of the apparment”
Reviews.Author: ioulioscaisar
Reviews.Content: I was booked the apartment (Appartements Pavillon) that is located to an another building than the hotel, it had 2 rooms, the first room is a bedroom with a double bed a wardrobe an A/C and a TV with no signal. The second room has a bed with an expanded second bed underneath for the forth person that it was broken, at the same area there were the kitchen with a small refrigerator and a scullery, a table and four chairs, leaving no room at all to move around. The view from the window is a wall and stairs. The bathroom was awful it was a continuous leak from the base of the toilet and the floor was always wet and the walls were partly covered from rust. The sheets were clean but the blankets had to see the washing machine for a long time, but the worst was an awful smell that came from the corridor of the building. From the reception the one lady that I have speak to, was professionally polite, but the lady that was serve at the bar was very rude. No restaurant at the hotel or near to it, a supermarket about a half km downhill was our snack and beverage supplier. It should be compared to 1 star hotel or hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: KeithJeff
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and big, but noisy. The staff was not helpful or polite. Very hard to locate. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “100 EUR/day - Recommend ( Hotel *** )”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreRocha
Reviews.Content: I normally try to book hotel with a budget near 150€ and four stars. And my review is centred with the PRICE vs QUALITY of service. Web of reservation: BOOKING.com Stay: 1 working day My Check In: 22:30 My Check out: 8:30 Staff: 1-10 = 5 > friendy staff, but don`t all staff speak english Services: 1-10 = 6 | Have SKY GOLD price: 10€ Clean: 1-10 = 6 | a normal cleaning room Comfort: 1-10 = 6 | The room is too smaller, but I only need this hotel to sleep and show the EURO CHAMPION final. Value for money: 1-10 = 7 | Don`t is in the centre of Rome but walking is 15 minutes and in taxi without traffic about 5-7 minutes. Breakfast: 1-10 = 4 | need to make some improvement Metro: Maybe Bus: Yes Taxi: Yes Train: Maybe (+) Is a new hotel (-) The problem to discovery this hotel. Resume: For this price and services, I going back if is only to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wallet stolen in my bedroom while sleeping”
Reviews.Author: GuillaumeNY
Reviews.Content: As I had to stay one night in Rome on a trip from New York to lake Como (the great discount on Alitalia was only valid to Rome, not to Milan), I asked a friend of mine to book an hotel room in the Eternal City, which he did at the last minute. Coming from FCO airport, I followed easily the indications you find on line. However I got a bit lost in the trip from the train/subway station to the via Clemente and the streets get very steep to climb; so be ready if you have many luggages! The Alessandrino hotel is located in a remote area very close to the Vatican and very quiet, which you might appreciate at night. But it's not an easy access to the center of the city. At night, you have to take a taxi to get there. Which I did twice in a day. My room was very small but very clean and comfortable (actually someone took a picture of it; room 201) When I came back around midnight exhausted, a sketchy guy at the reception asked me if I still wanted my free breakfast at 8:10 in the morning. Earlier in the afternoon, I originally said 9 and then changed it to 8AM. So I told the guy in Italian it was 8AM and not 8:10...a weird time I remember thinking. The guy corrected it. The following day as I got ready to go out to enjoy the morning, I couldn't find my wallet. Right away I thought I left it at the front desk cause I knew I had it when I paid the cab. The nice lady at the reception this morning didn't find anything and contacted the night shift guy who didn't find anything either. I was a bit panicking cause I didn't have any money left and was supposed to reach the airport to catch a flight to Milan in the afternoon. Luckily the cousin of a friend of mine lived in Rome and met me to bring me some cash (I admit I was VERY lucky for that). So I went to see the local police - the carabinieri- to make an official statement that I lost my wallet with credit cards and driving license, after I called Visa and Mastercard to cancel my cards. In that regard, the hotel personnel during day time was very helpful and cooperative. They even let me used their acces to the web. The following day when I was in Como, not only I realized that my three credit cards have been used for expensive sums at a local Rent car agency at the FCO airport, but I remember specifically that night opening my wallet before going to bed to take business cards and phone numbers I needed, putting it back in my jeans that I left on the tiny table near the TV, and LUCKILY placing my passport with my cell phone near the bed. Which means that someone came into my room while I was sleeping and stole my wallet (I was dead tired as I landed in the morning and had been waking all day long) . I know it sounds like paranoia but I swear I had my wallet in my jeans right before going to bed. I remembered even which cards and papers I pulled out from it to be ready for my trip the following day. And the ladies who brought me my breakfast at 8AM didn't get inside the room. Of course they could have come back when I was taking my shower, but my credit cards transactions appeared to have been done originally on Friday US time...which means the day before but if you consider the time difference between the US and Europe, most likely between midnight and 6AM Italian time. Then my friends told me thieves stealing people while they were sleeping happened often not only in hotel rooms but even in private houses! Some even used spray. Which I don't believe was my case although I was very tired by the jetlag. Retrospectively, I thought the young taxi driver that took me back to the hotel that night looked a bit odd to me but more importantly, the guy working at the reception at night seemed very strange. And I remember finding weird when I first checked in earlier in the morning that the only lock at the door was the key, and I couldn't tell which way was I supposed to turn it to lock it. Once again I got lucky my passport didn't get stolen that night - I placed it near me - but more importantly that I didn't wake up to confront the thief, not knowing what could have been my reaction or his/theirs. Apart from that incident, the hotel was nice and the personnel during the day too. But I would question the safety of the hotel itself, cause it seemed everyone could have get in and out at night... Guillaume, New York

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the "Apartment Annex" at all costs”
Reviews.Author: CHODZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, UNFORTUNATELY the "apartment annex " makes most American Jails seem palatial and comfortable. This is not even equivalent to a one star Korean hotel and should not be allowed to be rented other than as a hostel. This is by far the friendliest and most helpful staff working for a "slum lord" owner....hotel.com amd trip advisor should remove this Hotel from their websited until they drop the "Apartment annex" as a option to be "sentenced" to...abismal is the term coined for this lodging experience....STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Okay price, but bad location”
Reviews.Author: RemoTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and the room we stayed in was very quiet (5th floor) room to the of the elevator. It had a HUGE private balcony that was beautiful. The only thing is the directions to find it are AWFUL. Its up a hill that you need to climb, there are no restaurants in the vicinity. The front desk staff was NOT friendly, in fact they were condesending. I booked on priceline europe and would recommend it if you want to be close to the Vatican and are physically fit. There is no onsite parking, but the train station is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting last two days in Italy...”
Reviews.Author: Christine S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our last hotel out of four in Italy over a two week period. We'll get right to the point - issue first: 1) Directions to and accessibility of the hotel: This is the only time we were lost during our whole trip and it was a costly situation as no matter from where you approach the hotel (bus or train), it is uphill while lugging bags through windy, narrow, and busy streets. Even when we tried a cab on our first night, we had to lead the driver by the hand. Also, St. Peter's and the Vatican are a nice walk getting there but is a very long walk returning after touring, climbing the dome, visiting the tombs, and the local sights in the vicinity. At the end, you still have to climb back up to the hotel. Also, not many places to eat dinner nearby that any local would recommend. 2) Variable service by the staff : We had contact with 3 different staff members. Our first contact was after we arrived exhausted from getting lost and dragging our bags up there. The desk was abandoned. We each went a different way and no one. So, as last resort, I called the front desk and there she arrived. I stopped her from answering the phone to save myself the phone charge and she was not too happy. I explained that we had spent 10 minutes looking and had no idea when someone would return to the desk and that we had gotten lost and were very tired. This particular employee also did not help us to find the laundramat (back down the hill - like we really wanted to do that again that same night). Luckily, we finally found a local to help us find it. The other female staff member we came across was very professional. We got the feeling that she was very knowledgable. One night there was a man was at the desk who understood little English and was not informed as to hotel policies. Tried to get internet access from him (the wifi they talk about is 10 Euro for 3 hours-highway robbery compared to local internet shops). He had no idea how to give us access and did not understand that we needed a password and id. It was very frustrating even if he seemed like a nice man. 3) Carpet Issues in Room 105: See our pics - it was like something was spilled and something ground into the carpet near the window/bathroom. We wore shoes or socks to protect us from issues. Hint: Every 2 star we have stayed in in Italy has marble or tile floors throughout - no carpet. If you see carpet - may be it's better to try someplace else. We did not dicuss the carpet with management as we figured that any manager should already know that the carpet should have been cleaned or replaced. 4) We were not informed that the separate remote was for free TV. The brochure in the room displayed pay movies and porn. So we watched regular tv with snow and only CNN. The okay part - 1) The bed was not bad to sleep in especially after climbing hills - could have slept on a rock slab after that. 2) Breakfast was fine as we learned to hit the supermarkets for 100% juice and great meet and cheese to supplement breakfast. (FYI: Mortadella - one of their breakfast meats - is a contains pork tripe. Never keen on eating it let alone when it is sitting out on a table unchilled.) 3) The taxi to the airport they order arrived within 5 minutes of scheduled pickup. 4) The other good part is that by the time we got there, we had already learned a bit of italian and were able to take care of our own needs and did not rely on their staff after dealing with the two poor staff members. We came and went using our own initiative. Of all our stays, this is the hotel that we would not return to mainly due to the location up in the MONTE and lack of surrounding support (Dinner, computer, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “The kids loved it, the parents not so much”
Reviews.Author: EugeneLA
Reviews.Content: Got one of the apartments for five days, because it'd have room for the entire family. The word "rustic" comes to mind when describing it. FAMILY ROOM Good sized. A queen sized bed and television in the bedroom with a door. In the living area, a twin bed, a trundle bed underneath it that pulled out, a table, sink, drawers with utensils and pots & pans, a small refrigerator/freezer, and a small electric range. The bathroom is shower only - and while the fixtures are fine, the walls are in desperate need of a new coat of paint to cover the mildew. STAFF One person spoke perfect English, two spoke broken English, and the early a.m. guy didn't seem to speak any. Helpful, but not above and beyond. INTERNET The apartments don't have internet. There's supposedly an internet cafe down at the bottom of the hill at Via della Cava Aurelia, but it was closed every time we went by. Ended up going to an internet cafe across town. TELEVISION Three channels - one came in clear, the other two were fuzzy. Two Italian channels, one French. LOCATION The best part of staying here was the location. This is not a tourist trap - this is a local Italian neighborhood with local Italian people. No mass crowds of American tourists loudly yammering on about their MySpace pages, no salesmen trying to hock handbags or shawls, no beggars working their act. You pass regular people and hear their conversations and their laughter - you get woken up in the morning by the sound of church bells. On the same street Monte De Gallo, there's a friendly cafe/bar with some scrumptious cheap plates of Italian food. On the same street is a small family-run mini-market - great for sodas and snacks. But these shops close early - around 7pm. If you want to eat later in the evening, just walk down the hill towards Via Gregorio. A couple great restaurants and gellaterias here open til later hours. DIRECTIONS: GETTING HERE Take the FM3 or FM5 train to Stazione San Pietro. Take the exit to Clivio di Monte del Gallo and make a right. You should see cars and motorcycles parked on your right side, along with the train tracks. Walk up Clivio di Monte del Gallo - it goes uphill, downhill, and then uphill again. At this point, look on your left - find the stairs that take you to Monte del Gallo. Walk up this hill - at the very top is the Hotel Alessandrino. Even if you've got an apartment, check in at the front desk of the Alessandrino. For more info, check the attached pictures below. GETTING AROUND The Vatican/St. Peter's is the only thing in walking distance. From Stazione San Pietro, the #64 bus will take you into the heart of Rome, ending at Termini. Very easy to use - just validate your ticket after you get on board. Be sure to buy your bus passes AND your return bus passes before you get on the bus. Or you can take one of the trains from Stazione San Pietro to hook up with the Metro. Take any of the trains north to Valle Aurelia to change to the Metro A line, or take any of the trains south to Ostiense/Piramide to change to the Metro B line. Don't forget to validate your tickets in the station. OTHER STUFF ABOUT THE APARTMENT Beware the Roman mosquitos - they're huge and bloodthirsty. We ended up closing all the windows and just running the air conditioner for fresh air. And you'll get three heavy keys - one for your apartment, one for the hallway, and one for the outside door. SUMMARY Not a bad stay - especially for the cheap rate we were able to get and the wonderful neighborhood. But if we return to Rome, we'll probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely European Experience,”
Reviews.Author: Dzhon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Apartment Suite on the street away from the Hotel proper. It was quaint. and within an easy walk to the Vatican. The breakfast was very good in selection, quantity and quality but it was an extra charge. The suite was air-conditioned but below ground level, musty in smell and moldy in the shower The air conditioner wasn't able to overcome the musty smell (The shower also had a small lizard, which I needed to dispatch before using the shower) . There was also a surprise which we didn't expect, namely that maid service was not included in the prepaid price. I was told that it was an extyra 13 Euro per day. I ordered it and they did make the beds and clean the bathroom after the second night but they never charged me for it. Overall, it was a uniquely European experience, but if the traveler is expecting anything resembling an American hotel he/she will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: PrairieDude
Reviews.Content: We found the Allessandrino wonderful. The staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful in providing directions and anything else we needed. Close to the Vatican. Rooms were not overly huge, but very clean and the A/C worked like a charm. Breakfast (and cappiccino or esspresso to order) was free and delightful. I recommend the Alessandrino to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the apartment!”
Reviews.Author: SAH78
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for one of our nights in Rome, and chose it primarily because of its close proximity (10 to 15 min walk) to St. Peter's square. But the hike up the hill to the hotel would be a challenge for those with limitations with stamina and mobility. We went to the main desk to check in...it was around 12:00 and they would not allow for early check in, and told us to leave our bags in the hallway, out of site from the front desk! Not the safest, but we locked our bags and took the chance, as we did not want to waste the day babysitting our bags. When we finally came back to check in, they told us that we were staying in the 'apartment' beside the building...we had to drag our suitcases down a hill, and up and down maybe 5 or 6 flights of stairs before arriving at our room... Very very basic....TV with a few channels. A kitchenette (we didnt use anything), bathroom had one dinky little light, making showering that night hard. No phone in the room. Not a lot of places nearby to eat, unless you walk back to the bottom of the hill to the main road. There is a small grocery store on the street as you walk towards the main road. There was no breakfast included in our package :( In a nutshell, wouldn't recommend this place. Well not the apartment at least. Can't speak for the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: Schweizerchick
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 mights at this hotel last July as I was travelling alone for a couple days waiting for my daughter to join me, and I liked the reasonable price, AND it was close to the Vatican where she was going to sing. I arrived at the airport on time after 3 connections BUT my luggage was lost AND then the taxis were on strike also, but miraculously I took the train and transferred to the San Pietro line. Then I had directions to get to the hotel from reviews, and they were all wrong! However, I kept going uphill and asking pedestrians, and then miraculously I arrived at the hotel. At this point I was so glad to find it that anything would have been great. I asked the hotel staff how to ge to a certain church to see a concert that my daughter was in, and she told me which bus to take. At this point it was getting dark but off I went into Rome. She didnt tell me about the bus tickets, though. You have to have them in advance, you can't purchase from the driver. However, the driver just shrugged his shoulders and I rod e for free. I did make it to the concert. All of Rome at night is full of people walking and lots of tourists. I felt very safe walking around by myself after midnight, even when I went back to the hotel on the bus.. The room was nice though, clean, nice bathroom, Never mind that I actaully had no luggage, and I had to wash out my clothes each night and dry them on the air conditioner, which managed to kick out enough air to dry them by morning. The walls were thin though; one night I heard a person throw up all night in the bathroom, they must have had the flu or something. That was bad. The staff tried to be helpful, but Romans in general never tell you all that you need to know in one go anyways. I took the bus; which you can find via the big staircase, and did so for 4 days and we were not robbed. However, my teenage daughter was groped, so that was not good. We took a cab home once in the evening, and the driver found the hotel no problem, they seem to know the street Monte di Gallo. I found the walk at the end of the day OK. Good exercise. For a meal we walked down to San Pietro station and then found some outdoor places that were OK. Maybe my level of expectation is so low that it doesnt take much to please me?? Just give me a glass of wine with dinner, which is cheaper than any other beverage. I liked being in a neighborhood with the locals, and it was nice and quiet at night. I would stay here again, if only to show my husband where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: t0mb0y
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very difficult to find, but is reasonably close to the Vatican. I stayed in the 'apartment' that is actually a separate building from the rest of the hotel. The 'apartment' is in no way self contained - there is no kitchen, no laundry, no telephone and the bathroom was terrible. We also had trouble getting the hot water to work properly. The staff were fairly helpful (but not overly friendly). There is better value accommodation available elsewhere in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “a balance review from an american family”
Reviews.Author: unitedflyer
Reviews.Content: my family bacially spent a long weekend (3 days) for some sightseeing in rome. we basically decided to rent a no frills hotel for cleanup and sleep (i do not wish to pay for the use the pools, dinning room, meeting rooms, etc. which i do not use) and spend nearly all the day light hours travelling around rome. this hotel fit the billing. we chose it to be close to the vatican so that we wil be at the front of the line for tickets to vatican museum after breakfast in the hotel (other rome venue do not have the extremely long lines as the vatican). this hotel is up a hill, a gentle hike up at the end of the day after a nice long dinner at a nearby restaurant is no problem for my young family. the staff do not speak much english, but we managed with some patience and good nature (we do not expect everyone in the world to speak english). the rooms are adequate and basically clean with clean sheet, towel and covering (they do not change your towels or make your bed, it is ok with us as we keep things neat and clean). i do not have much space to tell all our experience, so i arranged them as bullet points. a) get to vatican museum as early as possible, breakfast at the hotel is a good buy. b) have your meals away from the tourist places. look at the patrons, if they are all local italian then it is a pretty good restaurant not overcharging smart locals, c) if you need to rent the annex, get the units above the basement away from dampness (we do not have the problem because rome is in the winter heating period). d) the annex is a short distance from the hotel on a separate building. turn on the electric water heater asap (i assumed it was turned off to conserve energy). e) we get taxi to travel around for four person, save time (weekend, not much traffic) and cost not much greater than 4 bus tickets, f) use the path next to the tracks and not the road leading to the hotel and the stair to get down. g) scout around for local food places (when you take the stair down and turn right there is a pastry shop that sells pretty good pastry, sandwiches and a good cup of coffee/cappacino frequent by locals). h) take all your valuables with you and leave your bag open to avoid being forced open, (italians are not going to be caught dead wearing used non name-brand clothing). i) watch out for pick pocket at tourist places, put your valuable in front of you either in your chest pockets or bag with sturdy shoulder strap swing in front. criminal will mask themself as tourist mingling around the visiting folks carrying tour books and dressed like us. look at their shoes, tourist always bring 'new' shoe on trips and criminal do not always change out their less-than-new shoe. j) print as much maps and info as possible (a picture is worth a thousand words unless you speak good italian, hand the taxi driver the vacinity map as Alessandrino Hotel is on a tiny street), k) bring a healthy attitude and everthing will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “twas very nice”
Reviews.Author: nottinghamimp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in may 2006 for three nights having booked through venere, using one of their standard discount codes. Only had two problems with the break in general, one being the total rip off taxi to the hotel from termin.(It was midnight on may bank holiday but even so i think 35e cross town to the vatican steep. The second being at the hotel when the guy on reception wanted to add 50e to the price on my printed invoice, I eventually sorted that but at 1am its stuff you can do without, the same chap kept trying to swipe my card takling ten mins to pay him, it was blantant the machine was saying use the microchip in italian grrrr. The room was very nice with exactly what they said it would have. After the first debacle the staff turned out to be vey nice and the I hear the breakfast was good, tho i didnt get up to eat one lol. Turn right out of the hotel and there is litte eatery which I was told was nice but we didn't use, and opposite is a small minmart which is useful for razors and bread etc if you only brought handluggage. I would suggest using the steps as opposed to walking down the hill its a wee bit dodgy with traffic. Its maybe fifteen mins walk to the vatican, down the steps turn right ( there is an irish pub just on the right there) a litte cafe on the left and another food place just up from the pub. Turn right onto gregorio and there are a lot of restaraunts as you walk toward st peters. Just before the station, which is on the right, on the left side of the road is the 'goose' which did very nice food with very nice staff and decent prices (prob the best we found anywhere with large nastro at 3.50e !!). On gregorio you can jump onto a bus which will take you direct to the colleseum and they are frequent. Hope that helps, in short the place is cool and we would stay there again.Incidentally if you do get a cab from termini they may not know via clemente alessandrino as its a small street so ask for gregorio to start with.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelNCruise
Reviews.Content: It is only about a 10 minute walk to St. Peter's Basilica, but coming back to the hotel it is mostly uphill. Returning back to the hotel then, you walk parallel to the side of the local train station appropriately called St. Peters(Stazione San Pietro) its side roadway is the cross-street to the main thoroughfare, and then it becomes a very narrow cobblestone walkway&vehicle path (watch yourself now) and then you take a right and go up a short (about 25 feet maybe) restricted steep roadway which will then become the local neighborhood street that takes you to the hotel about three blocks up. This is assuming you have taken a cab or limousine to the hotel when you first arrived, because it would be pretty darned difficult to take your luggage on a foot journey. The staff is very friendly and usually pretty helpful -- the full breakfast which includes meats and eggs along with some great croissants & butter, the standard fruits and cheeses, cold cereal, yogurt, and very tasty coffee with very rich and warm milk--it's quite substantial. The rooms are ok in size, and comfortable, but don't expect the same kind of air conditioning quality as in the U.S.A. We couldnt get onto the dial-up internet, always busy. But the phone system is great other than that, and even though we made alot of credit card calls back home, there were no phone surcharges! The cafes in the area are about one-third the price as the rest of Rome....which reminds me, this is not at all in a touristy part of Rome, it is very quiet, subdued and local-families oriented. I loved it for that reason, but especially the price of meals being so inexpensive compared to the rest of Rome. If you want to take the bus into the main part of Rome, there are lots of them available on the main thoroughfare adjacent to San Pietro Stazione, and one bus does a circle every half hour to St.Peter's Basilica (Risorgiamento Piazza) then to the subway station, doubles back to St. Peters at Risorgiamento and then back toward the hotel. The hotel's rooftop terrace where you have a great view of St.Peter's cupola was blocked off by housekeeping carts while we were there, but we went on the balcony anyway, it is fantastic. For the price it is a great place, it is quiet and not touristy, but be prepared to be on your own to figure things out. First timers might get a little frustrated....it's surely NOT a full service hotel, but it is still in my opinion a great place, being familiar with the city already -- and I love that it is off the touristy path.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: ellesmac
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in may06 for 2 nights. Hotel was difficult to find, you had to go to other side of railway station then up and around the hill. hotel not signposted at all. room was very small, staff not very friendly and they did not have an iron in the whole hotel! restaurant down the hill, there is only 1..owner cooks microwave food!...was very funny at the time and he was pleasant but we were too tired to complain as we had a very long first day sightseeing in very hot weather. cant recommend any of the restaurants in rome to be honest as you really dont get value for money and especially stay clear of food around st peters. my boyfriend and I paid 18euro for 2 peroni beers and 2 sandwiches! We read a previous review that this hotel was just 800m from st peters!......oh no it is not!!! its a 15-20 minute walk and its all up hill and after sightseeing all day you really dont want to have to take this journey back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: zuza11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alessandrino for 3 nights. The staff was wonderful. The breakfasts were fine although I would have to say my wife and I were displeased with the air conditioner, it never really seemed to get cold in the room. It was always cooler in the hallway. The beds were also rock hard. We used taxies a lot, usually coming home, if you don't use a taxi be prepared for some serious walking. If we went to Rome again, I would not stay there again. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “completely useless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when we booked a double room at Hotel Alessandrino we were offered "an apartment" for £100 a night (without breakfast). This turned out to be a short walk from the hotel, located at the back of an old block of flats, reached by walking through a basement, past the locals washing and up the yard steps. This we could cope with but after we had unpacked and opened the windows (smelled musty) we discovered there was no water at all. When we reported it to the hotel, they were completly disinterested. They already knew about the problem (but had failed to tell us!) and it was a burst pipe down the road. No, we couldn't use the hotel factilities (they still had water) and no they couldn't give us any advice. They suggested we buy water (shops all shut on sunday) or filled a bucket from the stand pipe down the street (what bucket?!) Eventually we used the plastic dustbin from under the sink and did just that. Bucket baths for the next 2 days! The water was off for a total of 36 hours, during which time the hotel only gave us (reluctantly at that) 2 small bottles of water to drink. Although the situation wasn't their fault they showed no interest at all in helping, they were not even sympathetic. The rest of the apartment was ok but the sheets felt damp and there were many hidden costs (breakfast 7 euros, towel change 10 euros) however despite this problem, we did enjoy Rome and even saw the funny side of our situation but we would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Take extra care of your belongings!”
Reviews.Author: mummymcminn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and food adequate. HOWEVER the left luggage room is open to anyone and I had a wallet taken from my luggage left there (OK I shouldn't have left a wallet!) but when I reported the theft- Several hundred Euros spent in a dress shop in Rome taken from a card -on my arrival home, the staff did not want to know and said it was the first time anyone had complained - not true. See comment of Manchester guest Nov 2005. I had great difficulty in getting any information about the manager/owner/group from the receptionist. I accept it was my own fault leaving it in my luggage, BUT I wanted to warn all other guests that the place is not secure and I did not feel the staff were surprised or bothered about the theft.

Reviews.Title: “First visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. We were ready for the stairs and the hill, after reading trip reviews but they were not a problem at all. In fact,after busy days site seeing this quiet hotel is just perfect. The room was clean and very comfortable, bathroom spotless. Don't be put off staying here by some bad reviews. Yes it's a walk , if that's your choice of transport but it's easy enough to find your way around. We found wonderful places to eat and Rome is a place we will revisit. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alessandrino, very clean, excellent food for breakfast, beautiful rooms with hand painting all round. It's in a quiet residential area very close to the Vatican and St. Peters basilica, the walk to them is all downhill, easy going there but get a taxi back unless you're fit and enjoy walking. If you do walk back to the hotel, you'll pass a small bar halfway up the hill to the hotel on the left, don't forget to stop of for a breather and an extra large sambucca to help you on your way :-) Once down the hill from the Hotel(about 3/4 KM), there's an abundance of public transport, trains, buses or taxis which you can get to almost anywhere. If you like site seeing, walk round the corner and in front of the St. Peters Basilica, you'll find an open top bus, 12 Euros will take you on a very good trip around Rome’s best sites. I booked the hotel through Expedia so got a very good price, the staff were very helpful and friendly and I would consider it again if I go to Rome. If you book this hotel, I'm sure you'll like what you get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to give it the benefit of the doubt but..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some mixed reviews about this hotel my friends and I decided to be optimistic and to give it a chance. On the whole very clean, and nice and quiet at night so had a good sleep. Breakfast was fine, room size was great. Location for me was a bit far out, by the time you come back from wandering around all day and taking the short cut up 75 steps, you're too tired to want to go out again. However I could live with that...we stayed there for 6 nights but on the 4th night after coming back to the hotel from being out all day I noticed the zip on my luggage had been forced open on one side (I make a habit of locking my luggage at all times) and it definitely wasn't broken via the airport! My friend's lock had been bent as well so she had to buy a new one as it wouldn't close properly. We told the hotel people on reception but they didn't look that surprised to be honest. They just said that their cleaners didn't normally take things but didn't offer any apologies or offer any help. At the time it looked as though nothing had been taken, but arriving back in the UK when I switched money bags again some Pound notes were missing, but it's too late now, all I can do is warn you and tell you about my experiences, but ultimately the choice is yours.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an apartment owned by Hotel Alessandrino for 10 days, and was in and out of the hotel daily, interacting with staff and sometimes having breakfast in the dining room. The staff were young professionals who spoke excellent English and were always very helpful to me. The daily breakfast was very good and extensive. It is free for hotel guests. There is a small charge for apartment dwellers. The apartment was full of light, with tall windows and airy drapes. There were also shutters to keep the room cool on hot days, and quiet during the night. It was very nice, with a small but really usable kitchen. I shopped at the little grocery store down the street and stocked up...and cooked some good meals. Also the grocery makes fresh sandwiches and has excellent pastries and cookies. I bought a sack lunch there daily, and it was always excellent. Very nice people own the store. There is also a great neighborhood cafe, I Tigli, good for morning cappucino and stunningly fresh and wonderful pastries. Also a good place for a glass of wine and a visit in the evening. This is a real neighborhood...not a tourist location. The neighborhood is charming. The apartments are in a building occupied by Italian families. It is a great place to meet neighbors. Friendliness and a little respect go far in these meetings. A ten minute walk from the Vatican, the mornings and evenings are filled with church bells ringing. The dreaded basement apartment was beneath mine, and was only described as kind of dark by the folks staying there. They wanted the ground floor because they had small children. If you don't want that apartment, just let them know in advance. I would advise taking the train from the airport and, after getting off at Termini, take the train from track 27 or 28 (it varies), getting off at San Pietro. It's a short walk up the hill. Make sure your luggage has good wheels before attempting. Take the exit at San Pietro marked Clivo di Monte del Gallo, and then up the hill. After a short walk, couple of steps lead to Monte del Gallo. There is another entrance to the hotel that requires a walk up quite a number of steep steps. But this is not the one from San Pietro. It's really not bad. I recommend using the train to go into Termini daily, and then follow the signs to the Metro...which will take you to within walking distance of most of the famous sites. Keep your wallets in your front pockets and wear your backpacks back to front. A good shoulder bag held under your arm works, too. The Italians who use the Metro use these methods. You can buy a daily Metro/ bus/ train pass in the hotel lobby for 4 Eu. Ask them for a Metro Map. It's good quality and really helpful. Avoid the #64 bus. It is an excellent way to be robbed. The train is clean and safe, and the Metro is fast. I hope you enjoy this lovely, lovely neighborhood and its people (and cats). I can't wait to visit again. Patricia Eger-Herz

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: chermar72
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alessandrino was quiet and cozy. It is located on a residential street in Rome just a few blocks from the Vatican and right around the corner from the St. Peter's Metro stop and local restaurants. The girl at the desk was very pleasant and always helpful! The free continental breakfast was fresh and tasty. The room was very clean and the air conditioner worked great! The bathroom was spacious and very new. The price was very affordable. My brother stayed at a premier hotel near the Pantheon and he spent 300 a night for a very small room which overlooked a noisy piazza! But for the price and quiet atmosphere, Hotel Alessandrino is so worth it even if it is located a bit off of the main city area. We would definitely stay here again; it was a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “day trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: KayQBerks
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 day in Rome (2 nights at hotel) and thought the Alessandrino was great. The position, ease of travel, views from the roof, air conditioning (outside it was VERY hot), breakfast, room, bathroom were all great. One slight moan were the lumpy pillows. Having read the previous reviews we followed their advice on travelling from the airport by train and into the town by bus and saved a fortune. However being our first trip to Rome we failed to validate our first lot of tickets (stamping them with the current date), but were laughed at rather than fined thank goodness. We are not that fit and Saga customers but the hill was not a problem. Glad we weren't in the annex tho!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: goldfishkeeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed ina triple room on the second floor. We actually ended up with a king size bed. The room was massive and very nicely decorated, was quite posh. We had a safe, air con and satelite tv. Had private transfers to and from airport, the one we arranged ourselves was 7 euros cheaper than the one arranged through the hotel. Was in a quiet location. Would recommend. The only downside is that it is quite a walk to anywhere (20 mins to St Peters Square - everything else a lot further). We love walking so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Under no circumstances should you stay in the apartments!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Under NO circumstances should anyone book the apartments to stay in. Have only just started to feel well again after returning in May this was probably due to having to try and sleep in a damp mouldy kitchen and who knows what germs where living in that bathroom! Unable to open window at night or during day as anyone could climb through, so permanent nasty smell that made you want to vomit. If the apartment isn't a health hazard then it should be. We chose to spend every waking moment away from the awful stench and whilst this allowed us to see nearly everything we wanted to see (including the Pope) it did make for extremely tiring days as a rest in the afternoon would have been a nice option but we were only able to face going back to the apartment after several bottles of wine. Whilst the hotel itself looks fantastic (just like the pictures on the website) the apartments are part of a residential block (not shown on the website), there is no maid service and whilst clean towels do cost extra this is definitely worth investing in as the room is so damp the towels do not dry and just add to the misery. The hotel staff (not overly friendly) pretend there is no problem and refused to come and look at the damp which was clearly obvious, we did ask for air fresheners but they never arrived. I will return to Rome as it is the most fantastic place to visit but I would not return to the Alessandrino even if it were the only building left standing!!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment A Annex: The Ground Truth”
Reviews.Author: Memphians
Reviews.Content: We knew we were taking a chance staying at the Apt. Annex b/c of the previous reviews. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. Annex apt is a two room basement studio. Couch in living area becomes two separate beds for two. Verify all the kitchen ware provided vs. the list given. We were missing several items upon checkin and if we didn't bring it to the staff's attention, we may have had to pay for it. TV remote did not work. Stove overhead exhausts litterally exhausts into the cabinet above the stove, not to the outside of the studio. Though you have to leave clean dishes, ours were not. Glasses had lipstick marks, plates were dirty, dirt on sliverware. We washed everything before first meal. No washer or dryer. Studio smelled horrible....mold all over bathroom and into master bedroom. No exhaust from bathroom to outside. Makes apt wet and ripe for mold to grow as pixs show. Toilet seat broken by previous poster does not look like it has been fixed. Sit with care or be charged for new one. Shower is as big as submarine shower. AC in master bedroom, no fan though so 16C in bedroom and hotter in living area. Asked for extra pillows. Always told "tomorrow, tomorrow." Thought we were eating at hotel with compl. breakfast per the www site but was not part of apt. package. Cost was 6.50 Euro per person to have breakfast. We declined. 15 min walk from St. Peters. Small grocery store on street and a larger one, Di Per Di, at bottom of hill. Turn left at post office, 6 buildings down on left. Good shopping deals. Train station at bottom of hill is for "train" not metro. Metro stop is on other side of St. Peters. Hotel did not make this clear when we emailed ahead for directions and we ended up walking from other side of St. Peters with full bags to hotel. Hill was not bad but you need to be in shape. Rome is full of hills. Hotel arranged taxi to Roma Fum. airport. 55 Euro one way for four. Neighborhood very quiet but smell and mold made for a very dissappointing stay. We will not come back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, believe me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bad critics are wrong. The hotel is in a quiet area close to the railway station san pietro. The Vatican is very close to the hotel too. We stayed 4 days in Rome. We used to take the bus 64 in front of the railway station. You can take the train to the trastevere station and then take the tram to the center of rome. Everything was fine at the hotel, the bed, people ... Great place, I love Rome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheMuirs
Reviews.Content: Have just had 5 wonderful days in busy, chaotic, frenetic Rome which was perfected by the election of the Pope and going back to the quiet Alessandrino Hotel each night, which is 5 minutes walk from the fantastic Vatican. (Hill or steps up to hotel are not too bad for reasonably fit folks). The number 64 bus from the train terminal takes you in 10 minutes straight into Rome each day for a 2 Euro return fare. One night we ate at the Piazza Navarro and then again jumped on the bus back to the Hotel. Buses run every 5 minutes until midnight. The hotel has very little noise outside as the road it is on is a dead end. The girls on Reception have excellent English and are caring and friendly. Morning breakfast is free and delightful. Couple of excellent restaurants nearby. Food about 50% cheaper than some of the restaurants in the centre of Rome. We paid 2 Euro's for a small beer nearby which rose to 5 Euros in the City Centre. For those who want the quiet at the end of a very busy day, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. We both loved the hotel and the staff. The rooms are very clean and tidy. It is in a quiet residential area, which is great if you like to experience the real Italy life and escape the hustle and bustle. The Breakfast included was very nice. It is only a 5 min walk from St Pietro station which has access to the underground metro system. We enjoyed our stayed and were amazed byRome itself.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend and Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: pvilletraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled numerous times to Europe and after staying in a variety of "hotels" we actually stayed in one that lived up to its name. For a week we stayed at the Hotel Alessandrino. Contrary to many postings the hotel is literally only a short walk up the hill from the San Pietro station. We found the location ideal to the #64 bus stops and many others including the #34 down the street from the hotel. We used public transportation all week without any problems. The hotel was very clean, we stayed on the fourth floor and the elevator is extremly handy. Because our days consisted of leaving after the delicious breakfast at 9:00am and not returning until midnight we were not looking for a deluxe hotel but the value for this hotel can not be beat. Our bathroom was one of the nicest I have stayed in while in Europe. The towel warmer is a plus. The room size is great, the beds though firm surprisingly never prevented me from sleeping. The breakfast is definetly a good value, giving you the fuel you need for the whole day. Just some tips..up the road from the San Pietro station (which can get you to the airport or anywhere) there is a huge super market by Rome standards. The front desk is very helpful and always courteous. So don't hesitate about booking a local, clean, and newer hotel that has more of a boutique feel than a large hotel in the city center with all the noise and grime.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vermilch5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeks stay. February 19 - 27, 2005. We had the annex apartment and it was outstanding. Rosanna and all of the front desk staff were friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. We found the location to be ideal for walking to the Vatican and the bus system was a convenient way to get to Rome. We found several local restaurants which we enjoyed including Jasmine and Otesteria Pontifica. There is an outdoor market with local vendors that is open each morning where we could buy fresh fruit, bread, meat and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but some downsides”
Reviews.Author: DrewDenmead
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, staff speak excellent English and are really helpful. Map usefull. Easy to get to from St Pietro station (out of back entrance, up-stairs that bear right, straight on up hill, down other side for 30 metres, left (up a few steps), past shrine of Mary (on right) head up hill about 300 metres and Hotel entrance is on left near top of hill. Do not need to use steps!! Room 1 is good, large but noisy, room 3 is smelly (damp) - both with thin walls. Try to get upstairs rooms - must be lighter. Breakfast good (bar Monday - when lady didn't care about cold coffee- water.... despite being told by many guests). Vatican really close by (but get to museum queue early - around the far side - as it gets very busy - so impressive when inside). Other tourist areas not so near, involves a lot of walking. Can catch train to Termini and walk (or tube) from there, this allows for 1 way walk only. Do see the Colloseum and Palentine Hill (one ticket covers both, though they do not tell you this). Will need to show passports for children at Collocseum to get them in free (but not anywhere else?). Get good guide book for Palentine Hill/Forum as soooo impressive and massive you do not know what you are looking at. Feet really ache, but so good will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Annexe Apartment: damp and grotty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annexe over New Year, whilst the location is OK (and the hill isn't that scary) the annexe apartment is damp and grotty. There were 4 of us staying in it, and it was very cramped, with 2 people having to sleep on 2 single beds in the kitchen area. Basically its cheap and you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was perfect! We stayed there for two nights but would have loved to stay an entire week or more. The staff was very helpful, gave us a map as soon as we arrived and circled everything we wanted to see. Without that we would have been completely lost. The room was a triple with two normal beds and one that seemed more like a cot. The room was Very Clean and we had a balcony that we could see the top of St. Peter's. The bathroom was clean and the towel warmer came in handy. There was no clock in the room so the Wake up call is a must. The continental breakfast was delicious, better than any I have been to in the states and only being there for two days we had a lot of walking to do and the breakfast helped jumpstart us. The friendly staff also recommended nearby restaurants and pubs that helped a lot. As for the stairs, they are easy to go down but take the long way back on the winding streets to avoid the stairs going up.

Reviews.Title: “Alessandrino hotel - what a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: gash
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Rome and we (two couples) stayed the week before Christmas for 3 nights and we can't fault it! The location was ideal - nice and quiet residential area close to the Vatican. The hotel was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful and we would love to go back again! We looked at the reviews and it was helpful to know the hotel was situated on top of a hill. Yes, there are steps up to it, alternatively there is a gently sloping pathway - the choice is yours. But get a taxi back if you can't manage either of these - it really is not a problem! Rome itself is abolutely wonderful and the people so friendly. Enjoy. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Annex Apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the basement annex apartment in early November. Totally agree with the assesment of the family from York. The extra room was nice, but the dampness cannot be overstated! We took to drying our bath towels out using an open oven. We, too, had problems getting dry bath towels without being charged extra for them (this on the third night of our stay!) The location is great. The hill is easy (take the hill and NOT the steps) and is very close to St. Peters. There is a charming, friendly coffee shop on the way to the underground sidewalk to reach St. Peters Square. We LOVED Rome and are ready to return as soon as possible, but we would NOT recommend the basement annex apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on hill!!!”
Reviews.Author: vmo1980
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. The hotel is on top on a very steep hill!!. The hotel staff are miserable and unhelpful and dont speak much english. Crap furniture in rooms, toilet seat broke just by sitting on it, had to pay for it!!!. Rooms crapmed and very hot. Its also out of the way of everywhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Annexe Apartment”
Reviews.Author: z0rcf
Reviews.Content: The annexe apartment is partially below ground level so the light levels in the apartment were poor. As our time in the apartment progressed we noticed a growing smell and feeling of damp. The air conditioning unit was in the bedroom and no way managed to dissipate the smell and feeling of damp. By the end of the week the front of the fridge door started to show signs of black staining (mould). By then we had also noticed mould patches on the window in the kitchen, on the ceiling in one corner of the kitchen and in the bathroom. Clothes that were damp (due to rain) never properly dried in the apartment and we had to use our hairdryer. When using the shower water would leak under the bottom of the shower doors onto the bathroom floor. The tiny bathroom foot/floor towel was inadequate to absorb the volume of water leaking onto it. The excess water had to be wiped up using a cloth from the kitchen. The tiny window in the bathroom was inadequate in removing steam from the shower and contributed to the damp environment. After the third day we asked for a change of towels because they were damp and starting to smell. We were informed that not we were not entitled to a change of towels. After a few minutes of pleading and reasoning (explaining about the shower leak and the damp apartment) they relented and reluctantly gave us fresh towels. The kitchen is also used for sleeping by converting the sofa. As the bedroom had the air conditioner we decide it would be better for my children to sleep in with my wife in the bedroom, so I slept in the kitchen. But the fridge and some sort of meter connected to the the same plug as the fridge were so noisy that they kept waking me up. Altogether a wholly dissapointing and unsatisfactory experience, neither the apartment nor the service provided were three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Lovely People, Unique City”
Reviews.Author: Citroenfamily1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the annexe apartment with our small grandson for four days in early November, so we hardly saw the staff nor partook of the breakfasts, which were not included in the package. The apartments are situated in a adjacent building and are ideal for families with small children where they wont disturb other guests. The rooms were more than adequate in size with your own, very well equipped kitchen/living area and a nicely appointed shower room, with plenty of storage space. The only thing that was missing was, strangely, a kettle, although you can boil water in one of the pans provided. The remaining flats are occupied by locals, which makes for some interesting conversations on the stairs! When we returned the key and picked it up every evening from reception, the staff were really friendly and gave loads of sweets to our Grandson at every opportunity - lovely people and great English speakers! The hotel is situated in an interesting residential area close to St. Peters and we didn't find the infamous bank to be too steep at all - and we walked over 25 miles around Rome in 4 days! Rome itself is everything that you may have heard - and a whole lot more besides; beautiful, but covered in grafitti, full of crazy scooter riders and Smart cars and with some of the nicest people that you could ever ask to meet; a place that everyone should be priveleged to visit at least once in their life. We could have cooked our own meals in the kitchen but ate out every night at a small wine bar called "The Brothers Bar" situated on the crossroads at the entrance to St. Peters Square. The food was fine, but, once again, the two waiters who ran the place made our Grandson feel really welcome and he ate more food than I have ever seen before. If you go, ask for Donato and Fabio and tell them that Christin is missing them! I would recommend the Allesandrino to anyone and when we return to Rome, as I hope we will, I don't think that we will be booking anywhere other than this hotel. Just don't leave your camcorder in the back of your taxi as I did and discover it missing as you are boarding the plane - its one big tip for the driver!

Reviews.Title: “the hills are alive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked the alessandrino via the internet for a two night break, the hotel is clean and quiet with helpful staff and an adequate breakfast included in the rate,you need to be prepared to walk but the Vatican is only 10 minutes away. My only problem was one rip off merchant in a taxi therefore ask the price to your destination The area in which the hotel is located is quiet and safe but there are no bars or restaurants

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuckfr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alessandrino is a lovely small hotel. Wonderful staff, very accomodating and helpful in locating sites and restaurants. Spoke excellent English. The room was not large but sufficient for three. Bath facilities escellent.The steps, one hundred and ten of them, are horror. And the alternate route to town is a steep hill, which is not much better. But the location is convenient to most tourist sites, and they will call you a taxi.There are two excellent, local family restaurants for dinner close by. Down the steps and to the right is the Barone Hostaria, which from the outside looks like a Paizzeria. Not much English, but staff tries very hardand the food is delicious. Down the hill and to the left is Osteria dei Potefici. Another local family restaurant with excellent food and decent prices. In both places you will be eating with the locals.We recomend the Hotel Alessandrino!

Reviews.Title: “Alessandrino - A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Libby
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at Hotel Alessandrino just up the hill from the Vatican - a perfect location. I have been reading reivews on this site for months and didn't know what to expect. We were more than thrilled with our hotel stay. We arrived bleary eyed from our flight at 7 AM local time. We took a taxi to the hotel and tried to check in. However, not noted on our flight/hotel itinerary was the fact that the hotel does not allow check in until 3 PM. They were very kind and offered to store our luggage while we collapsed on the veranda and discussed our options. In less than 15 minutes the concierge found us and told us he'd found a room and was having it cleaned. We were asked to sign in and sit down in the breakfast room for coffee and a light breakfast (a complimentary and great start to each day). Our room was ready in less than 30 minutes. We booked a triple and were very pleased with the amount of space, not to mention the hand painted details on the ceilings and walls of the room. Both the hotel and rooms were sparkling clean. Our bathroom was more than adiquate with standing shower, towel warmer and ample space. From our balcony we could see the top of St. Peter's Basillica and also it overlooked a wonderful, quiet courtyard. Throughout our stay the Alessandrino staff was very kind and exceptionally helpful with directions and anything else we needed to know. (Remember to leave your room keys at the front desk as you leave each day. Not only is it expected, but it's much better than lugging them around with you all day.) Concerning the stairs mentioned in another posting - There are about 100 stairs that open near the hotel grounds, but we much preferred the ambling street that wound it's way down the hill and opened nearly across the street from the Western Gate of St. Peter's Square. For an even shorter route, about half way down the street (Via de Gallo) there is a small shrine to Mary. Just to the right are about 10 low stairs to a shorter route to the bottom of the hill. Either way, the short walk is filled with the sights and sounds of Rome (small grocery shop, coffee shop, post office and residences), and is not strenuous in the least. If you plan to travel by intercity rail, there is a stop just at the bottom of the hill. I highly recommend Hotel Alessandrino to anyone looking for a great deal, great service as well as location - location - location! Ciao~

Reviews.Title: “ALESANDRINO HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Europe visiting Rome and Malta. I was there from MARCH 9TH,TO MARCH 15TH, 2004. The weather was cool and damp mostly. I spent three(3) days in Rome and four (4) days on the island of Malta. I satyed at the Alesandrino Hotel in Rome. It is a 3 star property located in a residential area. It's about a mile or two from the Vatican City. The location is good but it's near a train station (st. Peter's) and close to a main city stretch of road. Homeless people (who bother you by no means) stay near there also. The neighborhood, however resembles a working-class one. It's somewhat a strange place for a hotel. The hotel is nice and it is a new building although the single room I stayed in was very, very small and narrow. The staff are helpful and the continental breakfast was excellent serving fresh eggs and sliced meats. Rome- a travel must, is an experience. Their homeless situation and the poverty is overt. There was graffitti on most of the buildings. Also, the US dollar is "weak"(ONLY ABOUT 75 CENTS) to a Euro. Alltogether, it was a good experience.

HotelInfo.Name: Alessandrino Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Clemente Alessandrino 9, 00165 Rome, Italy
